key_points: White House principal deputy press secretary Karine Jean-Pierre confirmed Vice President Kamala Harris would be President Joe Biden’s running mate if he seeks reelection.
Jean-Pierre refrained from discussing any potential reelection discussions between Biden and Harris.
Vice President Harris clarified in an interview with The Wall Street Journal that she and Biden have not discussed his potential 2024 reelection bid.
Harris emphasized focusing on the administration's current duties rather than future electoral plans.
In a series of year-end interviews, Harris addressed the challenges she faced during her vice presidency, including staff departures and media scrutiny.
Harris expressed satisfaction with her staff and prioritized focusing on policy issues.
On the topic of voting rights, Harris has not advocated for changes in filibuster rules to facilitate passing major legislation.
She also avoided taking a stance on whether voting rights legislation should take precedence over the President's social safety net expansion package.
Harris' comments highlight a strategic focus on current administrative responsibilities over electoral speculation.
Despite the challenges, Harris remains committed to her role and the administration's policy goals.
spokespersons: Karine Jean-Pierre (White House principal deputy press secretary)
